characters: OFFICIAL LARS, SECURITY OFFICIAL ENDRE, AIDE MARIT, AIDE
THE PST DIRECTOR, SECURITY OFFICIAL LARS, PM AIDE 2 OYSTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An isolated white farmhouse set within dense pine forest. CAPTION: 21st July 2011. 90 miles east of Oslo. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man (early 30s) fills industrial sacks with thick black powder. Diesel soaked fertiliser mixed with aluminium. Me work. This is ANDERS BREIVIK and he is preparing for war. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small island on the eastern flank of LAKE TYRIFJORDEN, miles from NORWAY’S capital city, OSLO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The early evening ferry from the mainland. Crowds of excited teenagers arrive for the annual summer run by Norway’s ruling Labour Party. Among them: VILJAR HANSSEN (17), a striking young man and to all his friends natural leader. With him, his younger brother TORJE (14). They are met off the boat by MOTHER UTOYA (45). She has r the camp for 20 years.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER UTOYA
dialogues.text: Welcome back!

dialogues.speaker: VILJAR
dialogues.text: Hey! * The boys head on up to the centre of the island. Stopping a check-in desk. *

dialogues.speaker: VILJAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Viljar Hanssen... *

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. WHITE FARMHOUSE
dialogues.text: BREIVIK loads the sacks into the white van. Next the detonator and charges - which he packs in with pieces of mattress. Then he threads a long black wire from the sacks into the driver's compartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VILJAR and TORJE arrive at the campsite. Make-shift signs: Oslo; Finnmark; Nordland... They come f Northern Norway, so they make for the Troms & Svalbard ca

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: (as the brothers approach) I think I see them... Viljar! We saved a spot for you. Viljar sees his best friends - Simon and Anders (both 17)

dialogues.speaker: VILJAR
dialogues.text: Perfect! They hug and begin pitching their tents.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: So you brought a sleeping bag with you this time?

dialogues.speaker: VILJAR
dialogues.text: Yeah... my parents packed it. All around: excitement at the weekend ahead.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. WHITE FARMHOUSE
dialogues.text: BREIVIK loading a black peli-case: A Glock. A rifle. A shotgun. Thousands of rounds of ammunition. Grenades. He exits the farmhouse with the peli-case and drives away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angle on Norway’s government buildings clustered together the middle of the city, with a view of the harbour.

dialogues.speaker: AIDE MARIT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Prime Minister, here is your agenda for the weekend. Saturday you will visit the AUF summer camp on Utgya. For your speech...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angle through the window: Oslo skyline with PM STOLTENBER soft left of frame.

dialogues.speaker: PM AIDE 3
dialogues.text: Prime Minister, here is your agenda for the weekend. Saturday, you’re visiting the AUF summer camp on Uteya. Attached is a draft of your speech... PM reads draft.

dialogues.speaker: PM AIDE 2 OYSTEIN
dialogues.text: I've started with your personal connection to the island. How it inspired your activism, and then you push on to the issues...

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: (scanning) OK... I think it needs to be a bit more personal. More about my memories of the camp. And then I want to really address the challenge of youth unemployment. Can you get the latest stats over to me tonight, and I’1l re-draft and bring it in tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: PM AIDE 2 OYSTEIN
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: (to AIDE 3) And make sure we schedule enough time for me to meet with the kids... two hours maybe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: PM AIDE 2 OYSTEIN
dialogues.text: And those committee papers are in your briefcase. You should read them before Monday.

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: The oil sector papers?

dialogues.speaker: PM AIDE 2 OYSTEIN
dialogues.text: Right. (to AIDE 3) Make sure he gets to them on Sunday. They’re pushing for a response.

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: Got it. Okay I think we’re all set. Well have a good weekend. Make sure you all get some rest.

dialogues.speaker: PM AIDE 2 OYSTEIN
dialogues.text: Will do thanks. Enjoy the island. Hopefully the weather will improve.. PM walks away towards the door with AIDE 3.

dialogues.speaker: PM AIDE 3
dialogues.text: You have National Security at 10 in the morning, Sir. They move out into a corridor.

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: I'll do it in the Residency. Bring the Justice Minister earlier. (to office off screen) Have a good night.

dialogues.speaker: PM AIDE 4, (0.0.V)
dialogues.text: Goodnight Prime Minister.

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: BODYGUARD
dialogues.text: (into radio) Coming down now. PM into lift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: See you back here after lunch.

dialogues.speaker: PM AIDE 3
dialogues.text: Good night, Sir. The lift doors closes.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. GOVERNMENT OFFICE LOBBY
dialogues.text: PM crosses the lobby. Past a SECURITY GUARD.

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: Night, Tor.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Good night, Prime Minister. The GUARD watches him walk out to his waiting car. down by the burdens of power. INT. PRIME MINISTER’S CAR - EVENING See PM alone on the backseat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A campfire. Music, socialising. VILJAR, TORJE, SIMON and ANDERS around a fire pit. strumming a guitar. We see LARA RASHID (16) and her siste BANO (18) too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREIVIK on the road towards OSLO.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 9 Weighed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 11 12 13 14 EXT. WEST OSLO - BREIVIK’S MOTHER’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 11 He pulls up outside an apartment complex, in an up-market part of Oslo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREIVIK comes out of the bathroom, freshly showered. LATER: BREIVIK and his mother eating dinner in front of t TV: economic stagnation and the fall-out from the 2008 banking crisis. Europe's growing migrant crisis.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIKS MOTHER
dialogues.text: How is the farm?

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: It’s good. A lot of work.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIKS MOTHER
dialogues.text: I’ve been thinking, it must be lonely up there...

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: I see people every day.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIKS MOTHER
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: (gets up) I have an errand.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. MOTHER'S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Angle from a window: Breivik into a small Fiat Diablo. His mother watching him from behind the curtain, as he dr away in the Fiat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caption: 22 July 2011

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 15 A sailing boat cuts through the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEIR LIPPESTAD (40s) a criminal lawyer, making coffee on stove. His daughter REBEKAH(15)(in a wheelchair) watches. Other around.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: Ready to get home? REBEKAH’s eyes light up. LIPPESTAD (CONT’D) (smiling) Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIPPESTAD comes up onto deck. Sees SIGNE, his wife. Hands the coffee.

dialogues.speaker: SIGNE
dialogues.text: Better not...

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: SIGNE
dialogues.text: Looks like I can’t drink coffee for a while...

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: (finally gets it) Really?

dialogues.speaker: SIGNE
dialogues.text: Really. He starts laughing. They hug.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: Oh my God. How did that happen?  16

dialogues.speaker: SIGNE
dialogues.text: (laughing) You've forgotten?

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: I need to get cases reassigned. I really want to take time off this time. They round the headland towards Oslo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VILJAR wakes. Sees the rain. Wakes Torje next to him. They walk over to Simon and Anders’ tent.

dialogues.speaker: VILJAR
dialogues.text: Where did you get to last night?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Swimming. With some girls from Finnmark.

dialogues.speaker: VILJAR
dialogues.text: (laughs ) Swimming? With the enemy? They walk across the campsite to the canteen. We catch a glimpse of PM Stoltenberg’s photo, advertising his speech the island tomorrow. Viljar checks the seminar noticeboard. See: ‘If I was PM. and ‘Volunteering in Africa’ etc.

dialogues.speaker: VILJAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (reading) First seminar at 10. Football at 3.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERS
dialogues.text: Finnmark’s big guy at the back is out.

dialogues.speaker: VILJAR
dialogues.text: How do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: ANDERS
dialogues.text: Skinny-dipping. With the enemy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e  Laughter as they head into the canteen.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 17 INT. BREIVIK’S BEDROOM - MOTHER’S APARTMENT - MORNING BREIVIK at his computer. Writing an email: Consider this my personal gift to all Europeans. Anders Behring Breivik. BREIVIK’S MOTHER (V.O.) Breakfast. *

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: Leave it outside the door. BREIVIK swallows a couple of pills. Highlights a file: * “2083: A European Declaration of Independence.” Presses “Send all”

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER UT
dialogues.text: OK, good morning everyone... Today is the first seminar. We'll start with a little exercise, that I call ‘If I was President.’ What would you do - change about the world. Viljar you can start. + eH HH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VILJAR laughs and then goes up to the stage.

dialogues.speaker: VILJAR
dialogues.text: OK, so in Svalbard everyone is welcome, regardless of nationality. We've got Norwegians, Russians, Chinese, Croatians. All living and working together.

dialogues.speaker: AUF MEMBER 1
dialogues.text: Yes, but you only have a couple thousand people, how does that translate across Europe? LARA and BANO enter. VILJAR sees. *  10.

dialogues.speaker: VILJAR
dialogues.text: It’s the principle. Thats what’s important and if I was Prime Minister, that’s what I’d stand for...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 19 INT. PM’S RESIDENCY - STUDY - DAY 19 PM STOLTENBERG is mid-way through a security briefing wit

dialogues.speaker: THE PST DIRECTOR, SECURITY OFFICIAL LARS, PM AIDE 2 OYSTE
dialogues.text: and SECURITY OFFICIAL 2 ENDRE.

dialogues.speaker: PST DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Unrest in the Middle East continues. More Islamist terror, of course. But our main issue is going to be the resulting refugee crisis. The UNHCR is now forecasting a massive surge in migrant numbers trying to reach Europe. Angle on the document: huge migrant figures from the Midd East and North Africa.

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: Potentially what - several million * over the next five years? *

dialogues.speaker: AIDE OYSTEIN
dialogues.text: Easily. It depends on political * instability in the Middle East. * Syria etc.. *

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: And the challenge is going to be * how we protect inclusive domestic * policies with numbers like these. *

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY OFFICIAL LARS
dialogues.text: And it’s going to hit us right as * we deal with the fallout from the * banking crisis. *

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: That's right. Exactly.... *

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 20 INT. BREIVIK’S BEDROOM - MOTHERS APARTMENT - DAY 20 BREIVIK naked.  21 22

A police uniform laid out neatly before him, on his bed. He carefully pulls on each item of clothing. Attaches fak police insignia badges. Picks up a Glock pistol and strap to his thigh. Stands back to admire himself in the mirror. He’s ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VILJAR still in the seminar.

dialogues.speaker: AUF MEMBER 2
dialogues.text: What - you’d have open borders as Prime Minister?

dialogues.speaker: VILJAR
dialogues.text: No. I’m just saying whether we like it or not, the world is on the move. We’re part of a global * system. Better to shape it, than * pretend to pull up drawbridges that we can’t sustain. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breivik’s van drives towards the centre of Oslo.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BREIVIK’S VAN - CONTINUOUS 22A Breivik driving. He stops at a red traffic light. * His POV: Migrants crowded under blankets and tents. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breivik’s van enters the Government district. Parks behin the Office of the Prime Minister. Checks the time. Pulls out a lighter. Lights the long wir protruding from the back of the van. Puts on his black po helmet. *  23 24 25 26 27 12. As the fuse burns, he exits the van, locking the door gen He calmly walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SECURITY GUARD sees the van on his CCTV screen. Watch the uniformed figure walk away.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: (picks up phone) Hello. We got a van parked outside. Is it one of yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VILJAR, TORJE, SIMON and ANDERS - dressed in football kit walk down to the field below the campsite. It’s a mixed game. MOTHER UT@YA marshals crowds of TEENAG Laughter and excitement, despite the rain. As VILJAR walks out onto the pitch, sees LARA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREIVIK walks around a corner, and gets into the Fiat Dia

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The football game in full-swing in the rain. MOTHER UT@YA referees. TORJE watching from the sideline. VILJAR at the heart of the action. Scoring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREIVIK drives out of Oslo. Turns on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTION
dialogues.text: The van parked. Unsuspecting pedestrians. Norway obliviou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SECURITY GUARD on the phone to the DVLA.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: I’1ll check the number plate and I'll try to find the driver. He glances over to CCTV screen, where...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A second SECURITY GUARD is approaching the van. Suddenly: BOOM. The van explodes in a massive fireball.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. PM’S RESIDENCY - STUDY TO SECURE ROOM - SECONDS LATE PM goes to the window. Sees a huge tower of smoke rising the distance. Suddenly:

dialogues.speaker: BODYGUARD 1
dialogues.text: (enters at speed) Sir, we need you to leave. Now! His SECURITY DETAIL drag him out of the room. More guards responding.

dialogues.speaker: BODYGUARD 2
dialogues.text: Lock down all exits! The PM is propelled through the kitchen. Someone gives hi bullet-proof vest. Down a stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: Was it a bomb??  32 33 34 14.

dialogues.speaker: AIDE MARIT
dialogues.text: A massive explosion in the government district. That’s all we know.

dialogues.speaker: BODYGUARD 1
dialogues.text: Get the doors open! Through a set of doors and into a bare situation room.

dialogues.speaker: BODYGUARD 1, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into radio) PM secure. The doors close. The PM protected, but powerless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Government quarter devastated. Smoke, debris, paper casca through the air. A gaping hole in the ground where Breivi van was parked. And from every direction the sound of sirens and screamin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIPPESTAD and SIGNE docking in Oslo Harbour, looking at a huge column of smoke rising above the city.

dialogues.speaker: SIGNE
dialogues.text: What is that?? On LIPPESTAD. He looks down at REBEKAH.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: Let’s get in the car.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. FIAT DOBLO/TUNNEL
dialogues.text: BREIVIK approaches the tunnel heading west out of the cit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood-stained victims emerge. People screaming. Bodies on ground. * Police start to arrive. Staggered by the scale of the destruction.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. PM’S RESIDENCY- SECURE ROOM - SAME TIME 36 Chaos as the SECURE ROOM begins to fill with AIDES. The P watches news coverage. *

dialogues.speaker: AIDE OYSTEIN
dialogues.text: (holding a phone) The whole quarter has been destroyed. The Prime Minister's Office, Supreme Court, Justice Ministry.

dialogues.speaker: AIDE OYSTEIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s bad. Bring up news of the explosion breaks on TV.

dialogues.speaker: AIDE MARIT
dialogues.text: Is this gas? A gas explosion? *

dialogues.speaker: AIDE OYSTEIN
dialogues.text: That’s not a gas explosion, that’s * a bomb. It’s got to be a bomb. * On PM as he surveys pictures of the damage. On air * speculation about the status of the government. *

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY OFFICIAL LARS
dialogues.text: (enters, to comms) Can we get an update on security at the Residency please? *

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: This is obviously a terrorist * attack. We need to secure * government. Call the cabinet. I want the Police Director, the Head of Defense and the PST. Get in contact with them now. And then we need to inform the King: The Prime Minister is safe, the government is functioning.  37 38 39 16.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY OFFICIAL LARS
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. FIAT DOBLO/TUNNEL
dialogues.text: BREIVIK’s van comes out the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO
dialogues.text: We’re getting reports of an * explosion in central Oslo... See BREIVIK. He looks down at his GPS. His destination: U ISLAND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VILJAR with TORJE, returning from the football. They see TEENAGERS by their tents, on their phones. Concerned face

dialogues.speaker: TORJE
dialogues.text: What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: ANDERS
dialogues.text: An explosion in Oslo. Everyone's * been called to the canteen. * VILJAR checks his phone as they head towards the building

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow VILJAR and TORJE into the crowded canteen. SIMO and ANDERS too. Across the room: LARA and her sister BANO

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER UTOYA
dialogues.text: Quiet please! I’m going to shout because the microphone is down... Room becomes still. As you’ve probably heard, there’s been an explosion in Oslo, in the government district. We don’t know yet what caused it, but many of you have parents who work there, so you should probably call them, if you haven't already.  40 17. TORJE looks up at VILJAR.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER UTOYA
dialogues.text: In the meantime, we're suspending activities until we know what's going on. VILJAR pulls out his phone. Starts to dial. As kids quest MOTHER UTOYA.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER UT
dialogues.text: We will tell you as soon as we know more. Now please don’t worry. This is Utoya - you’re safe here.

dialogues.speaker: VILJAR
dialogues.text: (into phone) Mum?

dialogues.speaker: EXT STREET/BUILDING
dialogues.text: VILJAR’S PARENTS, CHRISTIN and SVEINN (30) emerge from a hotel door. The sound of sirens in the distance. Ahead of them, PEOPLE hurrying towards government centre. POLICE C passing.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: (on phone) Hi, I’m fine. Dad’s with me. We’re at the hotel. We’re fine.

dialogues.speaker: SVEINN
dialogues.text: (looking at his phone) They're saying it’s an explosion.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: Dad says it’s some kind of explosion.

dialogues.speaker: VILJAR
dialogues.text: Was it a bomb?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: We don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: SVEINN
dialogues.text: It looks like it’s over by the government centre.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: Are you both OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4l 4l1A

dialogues.speaker: VILJAR
dialogues.text: We're fine. Torje’s a bit scared but I’11 look after him.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: Ok listen, well look there’s no need to worry. Whatever it is the police are dealing with it. We'll call you when we know what’s going on. OK? 18. She hangs up, as they keep walking towards whatever has happened. More EMERGENCY VEHICLES pass by.

dialogues.speaker: SVEINN
dialogues.text: They’re ok?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: They're fine. They walk on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viljar hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: VILJAR
dialogues.text: (to Torje) They're fine. Mum says they’re nowhere near. Lets go and get some dry clothes. He smiles, ruffling his little brother’s hair.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 4l

dialogues.speaker: 41A
dialogues.text: CHRISTIN and SVEINN keep walking towards whatever has happened. More EMERGENCY VEHICLES pass by.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: (dialing again) Everyone’s down at Labour HQ for the campaign meeting. Everyone.

dialogues.speaker: SVEINN
dialogues.text: You should call them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: (phone answers) Lena? Are you OK? What’s happened? (listens, then to Sveinn) Sounds like the whole government centre’s been hit. (into phone) Have you heard from Erik and the others? ...OK. I’m going there now. Call me if you hear anything. Yes. Cancel all of today’s meetings. They walk on.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BREIVIK’S MOTHERS APARTMENT - SAME TIME 42 BREIVIK’S MOTHER watches rolling news coverage of the bom She goes into Breivik’s bedroom. Looks around. Calls his mobile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREIVIK driving. His phone rings: “Mother”. He doesn’t answer. Up ahead, a sign to UT@YA ISLAND. He takes the exit. Rounds a bend to reveal the beauty of TYRIFJORDEN. UT#YA ISLAND in the middle. He parks. Takes a pill. Sees a COUPLE of TEENAGE VOLUNTEE in a high-vis jackets, standing by the jetty.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: (approaching) Hi, I’m Martin Nilsen from OSLO P.D. There’s been a bomb in the city. I’ve been sent to secure the island.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOLUNTEER
dialogues.text: They cancelled the ferry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOTHER UT@YA is speaking to a huddle of TEENAGERS, trying lighten the mood. TROND next to her. A call to her radio:

dialogues.speaker: JETTY GUARD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There’s a policeman here who says he needs to come over. It’s about the bomb.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER UT
dialogues.text: (to the guard) Ok, I’m coming. (to TROND) You stay here, I'll go and get him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREIVIK sees the FERRY leaving the island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOTHER UT@YA on the foredeck. Sees the mainland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREIVIK watching the boat get closer.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 48 As the ferry ramp lowers, MOTHER UT@YA sees BREIVIK clear for the first time. He’s heavily armed and wearing what l like a black combat suit.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER UTOYA
dialogues.text: Hi, I’m Monica, I’m in charge. What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: Martin Nilsen. Oslo Police Department. I need you to take me to the island. Get everyone together and I’1l give a debrief about the bomb.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER UT
dialogues.text: Everyone?

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: Yes, everyone. It’s important. +e

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER UT
dialogues.text: What are the cases for?

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: My weapons.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER UT
dialogues.text: Well you need to keep them covered up. They’1ll scare the children.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: Of course. They start back towards the island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TROND gets a call.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER UT
dialogues.text: The policeman wants everyone to gather in the middle of the island... Trond, can you meet us? TROND, walks down to meet them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ferry docks. MOTHER UT@YA and BREIVIK disembark.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER UTOYA
dialogues.text: (to Breivik) This is Trond Berntsen, our head of security here on the island. BREIVIK shakes hands.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: Martin Nilsen. Oslo PD. They sent me to secure the island.

dialogues.speaker: TROND
dialogues.text: Well no-one called us.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: Everyone’s needed in Oslo. It’s chaos down there. You should see it. They start to walk up the hill.

dialogues.speaker: TROND
dialogues.text: (something about this not right) So which precinct are you from?

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: PST. Police Security Service.

dialogues.speaker: TROND
dialogues.text: So you must know Jern then? Isn’t he down at PST?

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: J@rn? Sure. He’s one of my superiors. Breivik (CONT'D) Is everyone gathered up there for the debrief? Monica We're calling them in now. Trond stops. A moment between them. Who’s lying here? TronD Do you mind. Can I see your ID again?

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: Sure. Suddenly, BREIVIK pulls out the Glock.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER UTOYA
dialogues.text: Don’t! BANG! BANG! TROND falls. Then he turns the gun on MOTHER UTOYA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tight on VILJAR, as the sound of gunfire reverberates acr the island. Around him TEENAGERS emerge from their tents. Confused lo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREIVIK on the move. Up the slope. Towards the campsite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More cracks. Closer this time.

dialogues.speaker: ANDERS
dialogues.text: I'll go and see what’s happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREIVIK still coming. Fast.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. Campsite - SAME TIME 51D VILJAR watching ANDERS walk up towards the canteen. More bangs. The sound of screaming on the wind.

dialogues.speaker: VILJAR
dialogues.text: (to Torje) It’s okay, it’s just kids messing..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREIVIK approaching the top of the rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VILJAR sees in the distance screaming TEENAGERS running towards their car. And behind them, BREIVIK cresting the hill. A moment suspended in time... as he raises his gun.

dialogues.speaker: VILJAR
dialogues.text: (realising)

dialogues.speaker: RUN
dialogues.text: VILJAR grabs TORJE and runs, as BREIVIK opens fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viljar’s PARENTS, CHRISTIN and SVEINN, arrive at a corner just down from government centre. POLICE CARS, AMBULANCES CROWDS milling around. Chaos.

dialogues.speaker: SVEINN
dialogues.text: (approaches a police officer) Was it a bomb?

dialogues.speaker: STREET POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Move back! You have to move back!

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Excuse me, Sir. I need to see my colleagues. We’re supposed to be having a campaign meeting. At Labour Party headquarter.

dialogues.speaker: STREET POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Please move back! You can’t come through. We’re clearing this area.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: Can you at least tell me which buildings have been hit?

dialogues.speaker: STREET POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: We don’t know. You just need to move back. Please. Suddenly her phone rings... The sound of screaming, running, and the phone being fumb through hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: Viljar?

dialogues.speaker: VILJAR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Mum, they’re shooting at us!

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: Viljar?? What’s-— The phone line goes dead.

dialogues.speaker: SVEINN
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: (trying to call them back) It was Viljar. He said someone was shooting at them.

dialogues.speaker: SVEINN
dialogues.text: Shooting? What do you mean shooting?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: He just said there was shooting and hung up.

dialogues.speaker: SVEINN
dialogues.text: Try him back.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: (dialing) I’m calling him...

dialogues.speaker: SVEINN
dialogues.text: Shooting what? What did he say exactly?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: It was really quick. He definitely said shooting. (listens) It’s going to voicemail.

dialogues.speaker: SVEINN
dialogues.text: Just someone is shooting?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: (trying phone again) At us. He said: Mum. Someone’s shooting at us. Quietly. Just like that. That was it. +e

dialogues.speaker: SVEINN
dialogues.text: (checking his phone too) Did he sound frightened?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: Yes. I heard gunshots. They look at the chaos in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: SVEINN
dialogues.text: Gunshots? We need to get down there. They push their way through the chaos and start running t their car.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. UT@YA ISLAND - LOVER’S PATH - SAME TIME 53 Back to VILJAR and TORJE, running into the woods. Panic. Hundreds of TEENAGERS. Gunfire, screaming behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREIVIK approaches the main building.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: (Sees faces at the window) It’s okay. Police. I’ve got it under control. Stay there and I’1l come and help you. He goes into the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREIVIK down a corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As dozens of TEENAGERS crouch in corners. Waiting to be saved. BREIVIK enters. Sees them. Raises his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of gunfire and screaming from inside.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. UTOYA ISLAND - LOVER’S PATH - SAME TIME 58 VILJAR and TORJE running. Looking for somewhere - anywher to hide. VILJAR sees a break in a fence. They tumble down a muddy bank. Scramble sideways onto a ledge. A dead end. Below t an 8ft drop to the lake. They’re trapped. Other TEENAGERS crawl onto the ledge behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREIVIK leaves the canteen. Crosses the campsite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VILJAR and TORJE crammed together on the ledge. The shoot getting louder. He sees SIMON. But no ANDERS.

dialogues.speaker: VILJAR
dialogues.text: Torje, look at me. Look at me. TORJE tears streaming down face.

dialogues.speaker: VILJAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s going to be ok..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREIVIK down the path. Sees the gap in the fence ahead. Climbs through it. Sees them all clustered on the ledge. Lifts his gun... He opens fire. PEOPLE falling. Panic. Screaming. VILJAR and TORJE jump.  62 28. They land on rocks at the water’s edge and scramble for cover. BREIVIK shoots again. Simon hit. Two others as well. And then VILJAR is hit. He struggles back up, holding his shoulder. Another shot, he falls again. Another, still he keeps going. Desperately struggling to escape. And another. And then one last impact punctures his skull. TORJE turns back to see his brother fall. VILJAR sees TORJE coming back for him.

dialogues.speaker: VILJAR
dialogues.text: Go Mustering all his remaining strength he splashes water at TORJE.

dialogues.speaker: VILJAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go! TORJE turns and throws himself forward into cover. Through a haze of blood, he sees the dark figure looming above him on the clifftop, before he turns away into the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lone SWITCHBOARD OPERATOR. A quiet room. A red light on her switchboard begins to flash.

dialogues.speaker: SWITCHBOARD OPERATOR
dialogues.text: (answering) What’s your emergency- The sound of screaming down the end of the phone. Then it cuts.  29. SWITCHBOARD OPERATOR (CONT’D) Hello? The SWITCHBOARD OPERATOR puts down the phone. Almost immediately, another red light. SWITCHBOARD OPERATOR (CONT’D) Police emergency-

dialogues.speaker: SCREAMING VOICE
dialogues.text: Help us! Please

dialogues.speaker: SWITCHBOARD OPERATOR
dialogues.text: (struggling to hear) Hello? Hello? The line goes dead again. Beat. Suddenly: all the lights on the switchboard turn red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HONEFOSS POLICEMAN #1 and his team scrambling to Utoya. *

dialogues.speaker: POLICE DISPATCH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Multiple reports of gunfire on Ut@ya Island...

dialogues.speaker: HONEFOSS POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: On our way. What’s the RV point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow behind SECURITY OFFICIAL LARS on the phone as he * approaches the PM - who is standing, watching news covera surrounded by several AIDES.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY OFFICIAL LARS
dialogues.text: (holding phone) Sir, we may have another attack. We've just had reports of gunfire on Ut@ya Island. +e

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: What? Utoya?  30.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY OFFICIAL LARS
dialogues.text: We're just getting details now. *

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: But we have hundreds of kids down there. It’s the summer camp.

dialogues.speaker: PM AIDE 2 OYSTEIN
dialogues.text: (also on phone) Local police are responding. But everything else, DELTA, it’s all here in the city. Dealing with the bomb. +e

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: Get on to the Police Director. Tell him to get everything they can down there. Now! *

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY OFFICIAL LARS
dialogues.text: We're on it. * End on shot of monitor. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HONEFOSS POLICEMAN #1 in his car. Blue lights, sirens.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (over radio) Assumed terror attack. Possible multiple shooters. DELTA are en- * route and will assume site command. * Uteya Island comes into sight.

dialogues.speaker: HONEFOSS POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: Understood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRISTIN and SVEINN driving towards Uteya. * CHRISTIN keeps trying Viljar’s phone, turns on the radio.  66 67 68 69 70 31.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We’re getting unconfirmed reports * of shooting on Utgya Island, at the * Labour Youth summer camp.. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEIR LIPPESTAD and family driving towards the centre of O Smoke clearly visible. Ambulances screech past. Police ca All away from the bomb site.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREIVIK in tight close-up moving across the island. Killi methodically. Relentlessly. He launches a smoke grenade. Acrid orange smoke billows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VILJAR lying on the rocks. Screaming and gunfire in the distance. The sounds of sobbing and pain nearby. He uses his uninjured hand to touch his wounds. Too many stem the loss of blood. He reaches his head. Feels the flesh of his exposed brain

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TORJE reaches the shadow of the cliffs. KIDS hiding, * including LARA. He looks to the mainland - it’s too far. Sudden gunfire above him. He recoils into the rock. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HONEFOSS POLICEMAN #1 takes the turning for Uteya. Down t steep slope. Sees Utgya ahead in the distance.  71 32. He pulls up at the jetty. He gets out and looks over to U Island. In the distance: dirty orange smoke billowing through the pine trees. Volleys of gunfire echoing across the water. Figures in the lake desperately swimming for their lives. On HONEFOSS POLICEMAN #1 as he takes this in:

dialogues.speaker: HONEFOSS POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: My God...

dialogues.speaker: FIRST POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Where are the boats??

dialogues.speaker: SECOND POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: DELTA have them. The RV is Storgya.

dialogues.speaker: HONEFOSS POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: Storgya?? But that’s a mile away! HONEFOSS POLICEMAN#1 sprints back to his car. Knows time means lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREIVIK sees the POLICE on the mainland. Sees a discarded mobile phone. Dials...

dialogues.speaker: EMERGENCY SERVICES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Police Emergency Line...

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: Hi. This is Anders Behring Breivik. * I am a Commander in the Norwegian * Anti-Communist Resistance Movement. *

dialogues.speaker: EMERGENCY SERVICES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: Anders Behring Breivik. I’m on * Uteya. I’ve just finished my * operation and I would like to give * myself up.

dialogues.speaker: EMERGENCY SERVICES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Uteya? * The line cuts. BREIVIK drops the phone. Moves on towards targets.  72 73 33. We see that this is all part of his plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRISTIN and SVEINN speeding to UTOYA. The lake comes into view. And a police roadblock. SVEINN slams on the brakes. They get out of car. The sound of gunfire in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: My children are on the island! You've got to let me through.

dialogues.speaker: ROADBLOCK POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: You can’t Ma’‘am. This is an active situation. It’s not safe. Suddenly, POLICE vehicles approach at high speed. Then ambulances. As they roar past, CHRISTIN makes a break for it on foot. ROADBLOCK POLICEMAN (CONT’D) Please, you’re not helping! The POLICEMAN follows. Catches her.

dialogues.speaker: SVEINN
dialogues.text: Christin. Christin! No.. He takes her back to the car.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: We'll find another way through. He pulls a hard U-turn and they speed back the way they c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VILJAR lies helpless. Gunfire in the distance. He moves h head. Sees the outline of lifeless bodies.

dialogues.speaker: VILJAR
dialogues.text: (calling out) Simon?... Anders? Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HONEFOSS POLICEMAN #1 arrives at RV point. DELTA UNITS arriving. The sound of distant gunfire throughout.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE OVER RADIO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Unit A to the south end of the island, B to the north. (NB Correct terminology tbc) A police RHIB is frantically deployed. But it’s overloade The engine cuts out.

dialogues.speaker: HONEFOSS POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: Shit! He spots a civilian boat approaching. OFFICERS unload int it. More precious moments wasted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A handful of leisure boats speed away from the mainland * towards the island. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREVIK sees them coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So does TORJE. * As they approach, he throws himself into the water and sw out from the cover of the cliffs, towards them. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREIVIK sees TORJE. Opens fire. The tourist boat swerves. TORJE disappears under the surface. Swimming for his life

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HONEFOSS POLICEMAN #1 behind the wheel of the second boat Feels the engine straining. Willing it forward. The sound of gunfire ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREIVIK ducks into cover, reloads, moves back across the island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TORJE still swimming. The sound of an engine behind him. He turns to see a seco boat, the DRIVER waving frantically. TORJE is pulled onboard.

dialogues.speaker: TORJE
dialogues.text: (as the boat speeds away) No. Wait. We have to go back for my brother! More gunfire.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: (steering the boat away) We can’t! We’ve got to go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VILJAR fighting to stay awake. He starts to sing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HONEFOSS POLICEMAN #1 speeds towards the island and catch glimpse of BREIVIK in the trees.

dialogues.speaker: HONEFOSS POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: One shooter. Two o’clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 83 36. EXT/INT. LIPPESTAD’S HOME. DAY 82B LIPPESTAD and FAMILY pull up outside their home. LIPPESTAD unloads REBEKAH from the car, as SIGNE ferries other kids inside. We follow them in. Through into the living room where SIG turns on the TV: Aerial footage above Uteya Island. Breaking news of suspe shooting.

dialogues.speaker: SIGNE
dialogues.text: (pulling out phone) I’m calling the hospital... On LIPPESTAD still watching the TV, as she dials. SIGNE (CONT’D) (into the phone) Hi. This is Signe. I’m watching the news. Do you need me to come in? (listens) I’1l standby. She hangs up. SIGNE (CONT’D) (to LIPPESTAD) They're calling everyone in. They’11l let me know as soon as they've designated a hospital. LIPPESTAD nods as she runs upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PM on a conference call. Grappling to make sense of t unfolding attack.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY OFFICIAL ENDRE, (OOV)
dialogues.text: Are DELTA on the island yet? Where the hell are they?

dialogues.speaker: PM AIDE 2 OYSTEIN, (OOV)
dialogues.text: Activate mass casualty protocols. Repeat activate mass casualty protocols. I want every hospital on standby.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY OFFICIAL ENDRE, (OOV)
dialogues.text: (on phone) I need an update on DELTA.

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: This is taking too long, right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HONEFOSS POLICEMAN #1 lands at the ferry dock. The island is eerily quiet. Rain, mist. He sees the bodie MOTHER UTOYA and the SECURITY GUARD. He leads his unit in formation up the slope, past the whi house. Towards the trees.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. UT@YA ISLAND - PINE FOREST - DAY 84a In the distance, another massive burst of gunfire. Suddenly, a group of TEENAGERS burst out from bushes to h left, screaming. He motions to them: Stay hidden. He moves forward up into the woods towards the shooting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SECOND UNIT land. Keep low as they move over the rock They scramble up to the trees. On to Lover’s Path...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BREIVIK reloads.
EXT. UTOYA ISLAND - VILJAR‘S BEACH - SAME TIME 85B VILJAR lying on the rocks, bleeding out. Starting to fade

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. UTOYA ISLAND
dialogues.text: HONEFOSS POLICEMAN #1’S UNIT emerge from the pine trees. POV: the canteen building ahead of them.. Weirdly quiet. He leads his UNIT along the front of the canteen building Scans the windows for threats. Moves inside... Down a corridor... into the main hall... Reveals a scene of utter horror. Bodies. Blood.

dialogues.speaker: HONEFOSS POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: My God- The sound of gunfire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SECOND UNIT round a corner on the path... Ahead we catch a glimpse of a pile of bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HONEFOSS POLICEMAN #1 AND HIS UNIT leave the canteen. Mov through the trees. Suddenly he spots movement. Hand motions his UNIT: stop. inches forward. Sees a black uniformed figure. Raises his until he has BREIVIK in his sights.

dialogues.speaker: HONEFOSS POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: (calls out)

dialogues.speaker: LOWER YOUR WEAPON
dialogues.text: BREIVIK turns, drops his gun, and stands, open-armed.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: Don’t shoot! I surrender! He starts to walk towards them.  87 88 89 90 39.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND
dialogues.text: BREIVIK lies down. HONEFOSS POLICEMAN #1 moves swiftly towards him, gun to h head. DELTA OFFICERS bind his wrists with plastic strip * cuffs. BREIVIK’s head in the mud. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As news of the shooter’s arrest spreads over radio, a DEL OFFICER climbs down the muddy slope and finds the shore littered with both injured and dead. VILJAR among them, lying motionless.

dialogues.speaker: DELTA OFFICER
dialogues.text: Casualties over here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, a POLICE OFFICER reaches VILJAR, by the water's edge. He has catastrophic injuries. His arm, hand and leg shot pieces. The right side of his skull exploded open.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Jesus. He checks for a pulse. Nothing. Keeps checking. Then:

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (suddenly)

dialogues.speaker: I HAVE LIFE
dialogues.text: He wraps a bandage, anything, around VILJAR’S shattered skull, covers his body with his coat. As OTHER OFFICERS scramble down the rock face.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (on his radio)

dialogues.speaker: WE NEED A CASEVAC NOW
dialogues.text: Hold on VILJAR, as POLICE urgently wave a POLICE BOAT in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLICE lead BREIVIK to the white building down by the jet Ahead of them, more boats arriving. ARMED POLICE and PARAMEDICS.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. UTOYA ISLAND - WHITE BUILDING - UPSTAIRS ROOM -CONT’ HONEFOSS POLICEMAN #1 watches as POLICE swab, fingerprint and photo BREIVIK. Macho poses for the camera.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: (noticing a cut on his finger) I need a plaster.

dialogues.speaker: HONEFOSS COP
dialogues.text: You'll get no fucking plaster from me. DUTY DETECTIVE arrives and BREIVIK is sat in a chair. A dictaphone turned on.

dialogues.speaker: DUTY DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: (to BREIVIK) Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: My name is Anders Behring Breivik. Born February 13 1979. I’m from Oslo. This is a military operation. A coup d’etat. The bomb has removed the Government. And here I have liquidated a political camp. Tomorrow's leaders.

dialogues.speaker: DUTY DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Did anyone help you? +e

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: I was selected for this mission. My brothers are waiting for my signal. To begin the third attack. (beat) But I am authorised to negotiate.

dialogues.speaker: DUTY DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: A complete ban on immigration. An end to enforced multiculturalism. If the Prime Minister is alive tell him if he fails to agree, the attacks will continue.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY OFFICIAL LARS
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Sir, we’ve arrested the shooter.

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: Is he Al-Qaeda?

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY OFFICIAL LARS
dialogues.text: (reading from pad) He’s white Norwegian. (see PM, this lands) He says another attack is coming.

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: Another one?

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY OFFICIAL LARS
dialogues.text: He says he’s willing to negotiate.

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: What does he want?

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY OFFICIAL ENDRE
dialogues.text: A ban on all immigration. An end to multiculturalism. He says he wants to purify Norway. Hold on PM. + + +e HF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: Keep him talking. Bring him to Oslo. In the meantime, close the borders, we need to lock everything down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The air ambulance lands on the roof. VILJAR unloaded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VILJAR into the trauma unit. DOCTORS cut through his bloo clothes.

dialogues.speaker: TRAUMA SURGEON
dialogues.text: (examining) Unidentified young male. He has a gun shot wound to his left shoulder...

dialogues.speaker: OTHER DOCTOR
dialogues.text: (looking at VILJAR’s dreadful, gaping wounds) We need blood. Adrenaline. OTHER HANDS insert tubes, fluids.

dialogues.speaker: TRAUMA SURGEON
dialogues.text: (examining) .»..a gunshot to the left hand and another to the right thigh... The ECG bleeps urgently.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER DOCTOR
dialogues.text: We have ventricular fibrillation! He starts chest compressions, as electrodes are attached.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Clear! VILJAR'S chest convulses, as the charge hits.

dialogues.speaker: TRAUMA SURGEON
dialogues.text: ..-And we have a gunshot wound into * right orbita. Exiting in the posterior. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOCTORS fighting desperately for his life.

dialogues.speaker: 95A EXT / INT. OSLO POLICE STATION
dialogues.text: BREIVIK arrives in convoy into the rear entrance. We foll him as he is brought inside, and booked. *

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: (as he is booked) * I need a lawyer. *

dialogues.speaker: DESK OFFICER
dialogues.text: You'll be assigned one. *

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: I have my own. * Hold on BREIVIK and bring up the sound of a telephone. *

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 96 EXT. LIPPESTAD’S HOUSE - NIGHT 96 Still the sound of a telephone ringing.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 97 INT. LIPPESTAD’S HOUSE - BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS 97 LIPPESTAD answers. TV on. Rolling news of the attacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Lippestad? I’m the Police Prosecutor for Oslo. We’re investigating today’s attacks. We've arrested a man by the name of Anders Behring Breivik. In the kitchen, SIGNE is packing her nurse badge and trai into a bag, and telling the AU PAIR to get the kids to sc in the morning. *

dialogues.speaker: POLICE PROSECUTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He needs a lawyer. He’s asked for you.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: POLICE PROSECUTOR
dialogues.text: He says he knows you.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: Breivik? I’ve never heard of him. LIPPESTAD looks over at SIGNE, as she comes in. Puts the onto speaker-phone.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE PROSECUTOR
dialogues.text: He says another attack’s coming. He’s refusing to talk until you get here.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: OK. I understand. (to SIGNE) The person they’ve arrested. He’s asked for me.

dialogues.speaker: SIGNE
dialogues.text: You? Why?

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: I don’t know. See LIPPESTAD, the weight of this. SIGNE too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIPPESTAD driving through the centre of Oslo. A city unde siege. ARMED POLICE. SOLDIERS.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO
dialogues.text: (reports the arrest of Anders Breivik) There is now speculation this is a Right-Wing terror attack, not Al- Qaeda.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. SUNDVOLLEN HOTEL
dialogues.text: CHRISTIN and SVEINN arrive at a hotel, now a makeshift cr centre. We follow them into the lobby is packed with MEDI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VOLUNTEERS; REPORTERS; VICTIMS’ FAMILIES; and TRAUMATISED SURVIVORS wrapped in towels and bathrobes. * CHRISTIN, taking it all in. Suddenly:

dialogues.speaker: SVEINN
dialogues.text: Torje! They push through the CROWD towards TORJE.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: (grabbing him) It’s OK. You’re safe. You’re safe now. SVEINN puts his arms around him too.

dialogues.speaker: SVEINN
dialogues.text: Torje, where’s Viljar?

dialogues.speaker: TORJE
dialogues.text: (struggling) We were at the campsite. A * policeman came and started shooting *

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: A policeman? *

dialogues.speaker: TORJE
dialogues.text: We ran into the woods. Hid on the * cliffs. But he found us. We had to * jump. *

dialogues.speaker: SVEIIN
dialogues.text: Did Viljar jump?

dialogues.speaker: TORJE
dialogues.text: Yes. * (he breaks down)

dialogues.speaker: SVEINN
dialogues.text: What? Was he shot?

dialogues.speaker: TORJE
dialogues.text: He told me to go. CHRISTIN hugs him tightly as he weeps.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: It’s OK. It’s OK. You’re safe. You've done so well. Viljar will be so happy you’re alive.  100 101 46. CHRISTIN leaves SVEINN looking after TORJE. Walks back in the sea of desperate PEOPLE. She sees VOLUNTEER with a clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m looking for my son Viljar Hanssen.

dialogues.speaker: VOLUNTEER
dialogues.text: (checking list) He’s not here. I’m sorry. She walks back to TORJE and SVEINN. Pulls out her phone, begins calling local hospitals.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: (to SVEINN) He’s not here. The phone connects.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello, my son Viljar Hanssen is missing, he was on Utoya. Do you have any admissions by that name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VILJAR being operated on. Hovering, like Norway, between and death.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. OSLO POLICE STATION
dialogues.text: LIPPESTAD arrives at the police station. Armed police. Military trucks. A scrum of JOURNALISTS and camera CREWS. ANGRY CROWD. LIPPESTAD pushes through. He is led down a windowless corridor. Waits as the cell door is opened, to reveal ANDERS BREIVI

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: (to a GUARD) Please remove the restraints. Thank you. Please give us the room. LIPPESTAD sits as BREIVIK is unchained. Sees the emergenc alarm button on the wall.  47.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE PROSECUTOR
dialogues.text: (leaving) We'll be outside. BREIVIK extends his hand. LIPPESTAD hesitates, then shake it.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: Thank you for coming. *

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: How do you know who I am?

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: I’ve seen your work before. Nine years ago. The Benjamin Hermansen trial.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: The Neo-Nazi case?

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: We met during the trial. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did?

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: You gave me your business card. I knew I would need a lawyer one day. +e See LIPPESTAD, dimly remembering.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: (tries to take charge) So Mr Breivik, tell me what you've * done today?

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: I have started a war. To take back control. Of Norway. Of the West. And defending me will be the greatest thing you will ever do.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: I don’t agree with what you have done Mr. Breivik. They were innocent. Children.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t exactly call they * innocent. They were traitors. The * leaders of tomorrow.  48.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: My own children have been to Utoya. I’m an active member of the Labour Party. Does that make me a traitor too?

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: You're my lawyer. You’re an exception.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: Mr. Breivik, the police believe you have another attack planned.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: The third attack.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: I need to strongly advise you, as your lawyer, to not do anything which might cost more innocent lives and make your situation worse.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: But Norway has been woken. Now she can be saved. You want to save her too, don’t you, in her hour of need? Hold on LIPPESTAD.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 102 INT. BREIVIK’S MOTHER'S HOME - NIGHT 102 BREIVIK’S MOTHER watches the news. Her phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIKS MOTHER
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Police. Please come to the door.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIKS MOTHER
dialogues.text: Police? What’s this about?

dialogues.speaker: DELTA COMMANDER
dialogues.text: Open it now. The line cuts. a

She goes to the door. Opens it to reveal: Dazzling light. Armed DELTA OFFICERS. As she’s led away, DELTA and FORENSICS move into the apartment. We follow them into Breivik’s bedroom. To his computer. On the screen: Breivik’s manifesto.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: BREIVIK and LIPPESTAD are led into a small interrogation room. They sit alone in silence. A one-way glass window. They’r being watched.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: You're not obliged to answer their questions.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: OK. I know. BREIVIK spots a camera in the corner of the room.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Will the media get access to this? I look like an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: No. BREIVIK fixes his hair. A WOMAN enters.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: (as she sits) Mr Breivik, my name is Detective Anderson. I am a detective at the Homicide and Serious Crimes Unit. My job is to get as much information as possible about what happened today. Do you understand you've been arrested in connection with the explosion in Oslo, and the shooting on Utgya Island?

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: Yes, of course.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE ANDERSON
dialogues.text: Can you tell me how you planned these attacks?

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: I can tell you 98%. I’ve been planning this for a long time. Two years ago I decided to take action. I sold my digital businesses. I bought a farm and devoted myself to the mission. Mental training. Physical training. Regular target practice. Honing my skills. Buying supplies. Carrying out reconnaissance.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE ANDERSON
dialogues.text: What about the bomb?

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: I built it myself. Everything I needed was online. Do you want me to go into detail? That’s going to take hours. It was a lot of work.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE ANDERSON
dialogues.text: Did anyone help you?

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: I am just one cog in a network. The Knight's Templar Europe. Named in honour of the Knights of the Crusade. Our organisation was set up in London in 2002 with delegates from 12 countries. We want Islam out of Europe. DETECTIVe ANDERSON Can you give me any other names?

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE ANDERSON
dialogues.text: We have found your computer, at your mother’s apartment. Can you tell me what’s on it?

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: My manifesto. 1500 pages. It explains everything. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. 51.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So people will understand what I've done. It’s all there. You see I’m an intellectual, as well as a warrior.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE ANDERSON
dialogues.text: You sent it to 8,000 people. Did any of them help you?

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: They are sympathisers.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE ANDERSON
dialogues.text: Did any of them assist you? DETECTIVE ANDERSON (CONT’D) I need to know if any more attacks are planned.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: This is a war. Attacks can come at any moment. But you need to agree to my demands.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE ANDERSON
dialogues.text: This isn’t a negotiation.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: I don’t believe you're ina position to dictate terms, Detective.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE ANDERSON
dialogues.text: Haven’t enough people died? I need to know if there are any more attacks coming.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: (beat) I'd like to break now. I’ve been trying to get medical attention since you arrested me. He shows a small cut on his finger.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I cut it on a piece of someone's skull when it shattered. I might get an infection unless it’s treated.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: Can we pause the interview whilst my client is seen by a medic? DETECTIVE ANDERSON turns off the tape. A moment between t They both know they are dancing to Breivik’s tune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VILJAR in surgery. Wounds being cleaned. The LEAD SURGEON probing VILJAR’S shattered brain tissue with extreme care

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. PM’S RESIDENCY - SECURE ROOM - NIGHT 105 The PM stands alone. Chaos all around. SECURITY OFFICIAL ENDRE approaches.

dialogues.speaker: PM AIDE OYSTEIN
dialogues.text: He could be bluffing, Sir. We just don’t know. Only the PM can make a call like this.

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: Tell him I’m listening. Tell him personally from me. I’m listening to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIPPESTAD watches BREIVIK eating pizza. A can of coke. DETECTIVE ANDERSON enters.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE ANDERSON
dialogues.text: (sitting) The Prime Minister has seen your demands. He can’t accept your terms. But he wants me to give you a message.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: Really, he said that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE ANDERSON
dialogues.text: It was a personal message. He says he wants you to know he’s listening to you. +e This lands. BREIVIK looks at the window, studying the dark glass.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: He’s in there, isn’t he? Watching us.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE ANDERSON
dialogues.text: We need to know if another attack * is coming. *

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: (eventually) Tell him I’m prepared to call off the attacks. For the moment. *

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE ANDERSON
dialogues.text: And how do we know we can trust * you?

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: Because you’re all listening to me now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TORJE asleep. CHRISTIN watching her phone. She rubs her temples. Across the lobby, SVEINN talking to a group of DISTRAUGHT PARENTS. He hugs them as they are led away by VOLUNTEERS. CHRISTIN watches SVEINN come back. He express desolate.

dialogues.speaker: SVEINN
dialogues.text: Simon and Anders are dead. CHRISTIN hangs her head. Moments pass. * Her phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christin Kristofferson?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: Yes?  54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Ulleval Hospital in Oslo. Does Viljar have any birth marks or scars?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: He has a bad scar on his neck. A fire burn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need you to come immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VILJAR'S FAMILY arrive. The LEAD SURGEON is waiting for t

dialogues.speaker: TRAUMA SURGEON
dialogues.text: (as they walk) Viljar has very severe injuries. He has a gunshot wound to the head and there is shrapnel still in his brain. If he survives, we will need to operate again very soon. * They go into a bare hospital room. See VILJAR. No signs of life. Just the soft bleep of machines. CHRISTIN gently touches his hand. As though for the first time. Begins to weep, despite herself.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: (to SURGEON) * Can I touch him? * (to VILJAR) * Viljar? Mum and Dad are here now.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 109 EXT/INT. PM’S RESIDENCY - SECURE ROOM 2 FRONT DOOR - The PM alone at the sink.

dialogues.speaker: AIDE
dialogues.text: (knocks, enters) The Press are waiting upstairs, * Sir. *  55.

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: One moment. He splashes his face with water. Straightens his tie. Tri to think of words to say. Then his phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: We've got the final number... 8 dead in Oslo. 69 on Utgya.

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: Wounded?

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: At least 200.

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: Thank you. The line cuts. Leaving the PM, alone with his reflection. He leaves the bathroom. In one shot he goes up the stairs through the kitchen, still crowded with AIDES manning the crisis. Across the living room, towards the front door. A reaches it, the door opens to reveal: a MASS OF CAMERAS. The PM takes a moment under the harsh arc lights. Then:

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We are all shocked. This was an attack on our government, and on our children. We are a long way from understanding why. But what is clear is that our nation has been attacked by someone who would see it changed... As he speaks, we begin a montage of archive: Norway respo The Cathedral, the Rose March, the first funerals attende thousands. The PM embracing SURVIVORS, PARENTS, COMMUNITY LEADERS including MUSLIMS. Grief, love and unity. ...He would see our democracy become tyranny. See our humanity fall... We must not give in to this terror. We must fight. But we must not become changed. Instead, we must strengthen our values. We must fight this terror with the rule of law, not the barrel of the gun. We must answer the hate of the few, with love the of the many. Only then will it be beaten... (beat) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRIME MINISTER (CONT’D) Because though evil can kill a human being, it can never conquer a people. It’s a rousing call to arms.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 109A INT. BREIVIK’S CONVOY VEHICLE - DAY 109A BREIVIK, handcuffed, in the back of the vehicle. An ARMED GUARD in the seat next to him. From outside: the building roar of a furious crowd. Ahead the courthouse comes into view.

dialogues.speaker: CROWD, (O0OV)
dialogues.text: Nazi! The crack of flashlights...

dialogues.speaker: CROWD, (OOV)
dialogues.text: Hang him! On BREIVIK... cast into darkness as the van sweeps beneat the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIPPESTAD enters the courtroom. Sees two PROSECUTION LAWY INGA and SVEINN (30s). He knows them well. They shake han But they’re distant. Uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE ARTNZEN
dialogues.text: (enters) Good morning. Bring in the Defendant please. Given the circumstances, today’s hearing will be a closed session. LIPPESTAD watches as BREIVIK enters. BREIVIK turns to face the JUDGE, PROSECUTION and DEFENSE lawyers. Each determined to uphold the system he has swor destroy; each his enemy, including the man pledged to def him.  57.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: Where are all the cameras? JUDGE motions to the PROSECUTION.

dialogues.speaker: INGA
dialogues.text: (stands ) Your Honour, police have charged Mr. Breivik with two counts of terrorism, according to Penal Code 174a. Investigations are on-going and we request that Mr. Breivik be held in custody while this work continues. JUDGE turns to LIPPESTAD.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: The Defense accepts this, Your Honour.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE ARTNZEN
dialogues.text: (takes a note) How is the Defendant intending to plead? See BREIVIK.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: I acknowledge these crimes but I am not guilty. The acts were necessary.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: (jumping in) Your Honour, he requires further counsel.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: I had a very happy upbringing. I grew up in west Oslo. My parents divorced amicably when I was very young. I maintain a close relationship with my mother. My half-sister and I are not particularly close but we speak occasionally. +e + eH HH  113 114 OMITTED. OMITTED. 58.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: What about your father?

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: I haven't seen him since I was 16. I spoke to him a couple of years ago. But there was really no time to meet. He lived in France and I was focused on my career, my internet businesses.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: How would you describe your relationship with your mother?

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: It’s good you know. Normal. My mother had nothing to do with this. She’s really not relevant.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: It’s about understanding what led you to do this.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: How many children do you have, Mr. Lippestad?

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: (caught off guard) Five.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: And you love them?

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) Of course.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIK
dialogues.text: I wanted to hit them where it would hurt the most. (beat) Do you understand now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PM’s car pulls into the government quarter. He gets o Ahead of him: devastation.

dialogues.speaker: AIDE
dialogues.text: He drove along Grubbegata and parked at the rear of the building. (beat) We’re lucky the whole building didn’t come down. See the PM, lost in thought at the magnitude.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. PM’S RESIDENCY - LIVING ROOM (MEETING ROOM) - LATER1 The PM in his living room - hastily transformed into a ma shift office. A security meeting: The PST DIRECTOR, SECUR

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: He buys 900 kilos of fertilser and aluminum nitrate, and no red flags?

dialogues.speaker: HEAD OF PST
dialogues.text: Sir, our focus has been on Islamist terror. Foreign threats.

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: But we know the Far-Right is growing fast.

dialogues.speaker: HEAD OF PST
dialogues.text: We can’t stop every threat. We did the best we could.

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: We should have done much better. I want to upgrade our national security. Intelligence. Defence. Policing. Everything. And I'm ordering a public inquiry. An inquiry into what happened and how we responded. Something went badly wrong. And we need to find out what. It’s the only way we’ll get through this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A surgical drill cuts into bone. A microscopic camera ent brain tissue. On a screen, SURGEONS remove fragments of Breivik’s bullet. VILJAR'S second operation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SVEINN on the phone. A TV in the corner while he waits fo answer. Sees news reports of rising public anger.

dialogues.speaker: SVEINN
dialogues.text: Hi. It’s Sveinn. Christin asked me to call. She’s suspending the campaign. And Torje’s staying here with us. I’ve told the school. The news report changes on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: SVEINN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (watching TV) Ok, thanks. She'll appreciate that. Bye. Then he calls Torje’s school. Lastly, he calls work.

dialogues.speaker: SVEINN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Listen, can you hand over my field work to Erik? And make sure the new mercury data gets put into the system. Yeah, I’m fine. (beat) We've just got to take it one day at a time. He hangs up and watches the TV as BREIVIK’S FATHER gives interview: BREIVIK’S FATHER I haven't seen Anders in years. I am appalled.. I think it would have been better if he had just killed himself. SVEINN walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 119 120 61. INT. ULLEVAL HOSPITAL - VILJAR’S ICU ROOM - CONTINUOUS 11 SVEINN reaches VILJAR’s room. CHRISTIN and TORJE are sitt He puts his arm around TORJE.

dialogues.speaker: SVEINN
dialogues.text: (to CHRISTIN) You OK?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: Yeah. I’m fine. The LEAD SURGEON enters. See them struggling to keep it together. Through an angle in the window, we see VILJAR brought bac from theatre.

dialogues.speaker: LEAD SURGEON
dialogues.text: Viljar’s in recovery. I’m afraid we couldn’t get all the shrapnel. It was too deep. We’1l have to wait for him to wake up, before we can assess the damage. Our concern right now is infection. We’ve put him on some strong antibiotics, and we're monitoring him closely. But there’s nothing more we can do for Viljar now. He needs to wake up.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. LIPPESTAD’S OFFICE - MEETING ROOM - DAY 120 Boxes of police evidence on the table. LIPPESTAD, VIBEKE LAWYER, and TWO ASSISTANTS leaf through files.

dialogues.speaker: VIBEKE DEF. LAWYER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It was a very dysfunctional family. Breivik’s parents split acrimoniously when he was very young. Insert: LIPPESTAD looks at ABB’s SOCIAL SERVICES FILES.

dialogues.speaker: VIBEKE DEF LAWYER
dialogues.text: His mother couldn’t cope. She wrote to Social Services asking for help. They put Breivik under psychiatric observation. They had serious doubts about his mother’s capacity to parent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: And his father?

dialogues.speaker: VIBEKE DEF. LAWYER
dialogues.text: After the marriage collapsed, his father cut him off.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: And the half-sister? Insert: LIPPESTAD looks at a photo of YOUNG BREIVIK.

dialogues.speaker: VIBEKE DEF. LAWYER
dialogues.text: She emigrated to California. When he was about 16 I think.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: 16? 17?.. Yeah ok.. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: VIBEKE DEF. LAWYER
dialogues.text: It was just him and his mother after that. Insert: LIPPESTAD looks at photos of TEENAGE BREIVIK.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: He was obviously very isolated all the way into adulthood. Always had trouble fitting in.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD ASSISTANT 2
dialogues.text: Not exactly the picture he painted.

dialogues.speaker: VIBEKE DEF. LAWYER
dialogues.text: No, not it’s not. INSERT: LIPPESTAD opens a file of crime scene photos. Pho of DEAD BODIES.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: So what are we talking about here? Pursuing insanity as a defense?

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD ASSISTANT 2
dialogues.text: It’s possible.

dialogues.speaker: VIBEKE DEF. LAWYER
dialogues.text: How else do we explain it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 121 122 63. EXT. BREIVIK’S MOTHER’S HOUSE - DAY 121 LIPPESTAD pulls up outside. Looks at the apartment block.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BREIVIK’S MOTHER'S HOUSE - DAY 122 LIPPESTAD opposite BREIVIK’S MOTHER. The curtains closed.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: My name is Geir Lippestad. I’ve been appointed by your son to lead his defence. Now I know Anders doesn’t have a relationship with his father. So I wanted to ask you some questions. We need to decide how to build his case. +e BREIVIK’S MOTHER Yes, of course.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: What was Anders like as a child? BREIVIK’S MOTHER He was a normal boy. Kind, clever Lots of friends. He loved his mother. I was a single parent after * his father left us, but I made sure * he had a normal childhood. We had a very nice house.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: Did he have any medical conditions? Any mental health issues? BREIVIK’S MOTHER Oh no.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: Was he ever violent? BREIVIK’S MOTHER Never. He loved me. He loved affection.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: Did you have any dealings with social services? * He sees her hands shaking. She’s on the edge. *  64. BREIVIK’S MOTHER That was nothing. Welfare state sticking their nose in. I thought I needed their help, but I didn’t. He was fine.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: I see. (beat) Did you have any sense recently that Anders was having problems?

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIKS MOTHER
dialogues.text: No. (beat) I told the police that I saw he had guns in his bedroom. But he told me he needed them for hunting. I believed him.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: Would you consider testifying in Anders’ defense?

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIKS MOTHER
dialogues.text: What would I say?

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: Just that there were problems. In his childhood. It would help him. BREIVIK’S MOTHER But then everyone will know.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: Anders is entitled to a defense, just like everyone else.

dialogues.speaker: BREIVIKS MOTHER
dialogues.text: But I’1ll be the most hated mother in Norway.

dialogues.speaker: LIPPESTAD
dialogues.text: Please consider it. LIPPESTAD goes to the door. BREIVIK’S MOTHER He’s sort of right though, isn’t he. About the way the country is going. It’s not what it used to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH HH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 123 65. INT. ULLEVAL HOSPITAL - VILJAR’S ICU ROOM - NIGHT 123 VILJAR still unconscious. CHRISTIN exhausted. Outside SEV DOCTORS confer with SVEINN, obviously concerned.

dialogues.speaker: SVEINN
dialogues.text: (comes in) He should have woken by now. His * temperature is up. Might be * infection. * They watch the DOCTORS leave.

dialogues.speaker: SVEIIN
dialogues.text: I'll take Torje back to the hotel. Will you be OK?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: I'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: SVEIIN
dialogues.text: Call me if anything changes.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: Can you bring me clothes? *

dialogues.speaker: SVEIIN
dialogues.text: Sure. *

dialogues.speaker: TORJE
dialogues.text: (suddenly) He told me to go. He told me to leave him!

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: (hugs him) It’s okay. You did the right thing. * See TORJE, in anguish. *

dialogues.speaker: SVEINN
dialogues.text: (putting his arm around * him) * Come on. * They leave. CHRISTIN sits for a moment. Then softly, starts to sing. nursery rhyme. We recognise it. Viljar sang it on the isl

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 125 INT. ULLEVAL HOSPITAL - VILJAR’S ICU ROOM - EARLY MOR A tap at the door. CHRISTIN looks up. It’s LARA.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Hi, I’m Lara...

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: Hi Lara..

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: I was on the island. I’m visiting survivors. How's Viljar?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: He needs to wake up. They both look down at VILJAR.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you OK?

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: I’m fine. (beat) My sister didn’t make it.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry. She hugs LARA. It’s a bit awkward. CHRISTIN (CONT’D) What was her name?

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Bano. A moment between them.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: She'd be so happy you're alive, Lara. SVEINN enters with TORJE, fresh coffee. He looks exhauste Sees LARA.  126 127

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: This is Lara. She was on the island. She wanted to see how Viljar was doing.

dialogues.speaker: SVEINN
dialogues.text: That’s kind.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: Do you know Viljar well?

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: No, but everyone knows Viljar. I played against him in the football. He’s good! SVEINN smiles. An awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: LARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I should go. (beat) I’11 come back when he wakes up. It’s a small but powerful gesture of faith.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIN
dialogues.text: Thank you. She turns back to VILJAR, still unconscious. 67.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. LIPPESTAD’S HOUSE - NIGHT LIPPESTAD parks. 126

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
